page.title: 07EDUCATION - VILLAGE SCHOOL
page.content: We talked to some elderly residents who live in the village about their time at Napton School. They got up early in the morning and had a cooked breakfast and then walked to school. School in the olden days was very different than today. First of all the little children wrote in sand, then they copied letters from the blackboard on a slate using special chalk, then a pencil and paper. When they could write well, they used a pen dipped in ink. The desks had a lid which lifted up and an inkwell. Most work was copied from the blackboard, they could not choose their work or walk about. The teachers were very strict. All the children went home for dinner. The elderly people showed us lovely photographs of themselves in pretty white dresses which they wore on May 24th, Empire Day celebrations.
